data.title: Bellisario College of Communications
data.text:
Major: Advertising

Minor: Entrepreneurship & Innovation and Digital Media Trends & Analytics

What are you involved in? Associate Creative Director and Plans Book Designer, The Nittany Group, American Advertising Federation National Student Advertising Competition (AAF NSAC); Graphic design Intern, Penn State Athletics; Outreach Chair, Ad/PR Club; Lead Ambassador, Entrepreneurship & Innovation Minor; Learning Assistant, ENGR 310 Entrepreneurial Leadership; Bellisario Mentors; Bellisario Fellow; General Member, Trilogy Benefitting THON

What’s the dream career? Chief Creative Officer at a NYC advertising agency

What is something you wish you had known as a first-year student? The friends you meet in your Bellisario College clubs/orgs will become some of your closest friends on campus!

If someone was to describe you in five words, what words do you think they would choose? Kind, hardworking, creative, tenacious, witty

Fun Fact: I own about 30 cardigans. My advertising friends literally take bets on if I will be wearing one when I show up to our org!

Major: Broadcast Journalism

Minor: African American Studies and a diversity studies certificate

What are you involved in? President of Penn State Chapter of National Assocation of Black Journalists, Culture Central News Anchor, Centre County Report News Anchor, Bams Co-director of Communications, VALLEY Magazine print writer!

What’s the dream career? Youngest black woman anchor on a national TV station.

What is something you wish you had known as a first-year student? That your end is not your beginning.

If someone was to describe you in five words, what words do you think they would choose? Tenacious, supportive, caring, intuitive, kind

Fun Fact: I used to be able to eat Play-Doh as a kid.

Major: Advertising

Minor: Digital Media Trends and Analytics, Smeal Certificate

What are you involved in? Happy Valley Comm, VALLEY Magazine

What’s the dream career? Director of Advertising Operations of a company in the beauty, food, or lifestyle industry / Account Executive at a marketing communications agency

What is something that you wish you had known as a first-year student? I wish I knew to get involved right away and put myself out there instead of waiting for opportunities to come find me.

If someone was to describe you in 5 words, what words do you think they would choose? Short, responsible, organized, compassionate, motivated

Fun Fact: My dog made the quarterfinals of America's Favorite Pet.

Major: Advertising

Minor: Digital Media Trends & Analytics

What are you involved in? I am an active member in Penn States AD/PR Club (host high up alumni for students to get a feel of after-college life), AAF (American Student Advertising Federation, won 1st place in our district last year, on Experiential Advertising Team, primed for a head research role this upcoming fall/spring), and I partake in numerous Intermural Athletics (Softball, Basketball, Soccer, Football)

What’s the dream career? As of right now, I would love to be working on specific advertising accounts at an advertising agency. Something about choosing the right talent, clients, or whatever a brand/company may need to be seen the right way has intrigued me.

What is something that you wish you had known as a first-year student? I wish I would have known to get more involved with what you are passionate about! Finding your groove is so important, and something I did not take advantage of last year was trying new things like I did this year to really test my interests. I am very excited for what my futures holds now here at PSU, but even after.

If someone was to describe you in five words, what words do you think they would choose? Humorous, empathetic, determined, passionate, kind

Fun Fact: I actually wanted to go to college for athletics growing up, so when I was really into basketball, I played on an AAU team with current NBA player, Dereck Lively II on the Dallas Mavericks. I played with him for a year when I was 14, and it really showed me that you needed to have what it takes to be good at the next level (which I did not, lol), but nonetheless, a great teammate, and story to tell for years to come.

Major: Journalism

Minor: Digital Media Trends & Analytics

Certificate: Fundraising & Advancement

What are you involved in? Advertising Chair - Bellisario Student Council, President - Atlas Benefiting THON, Talk Show Host & DJ - CommRadio

What’s the dream career? I want to be a publicist for someone in the entertainment, music, or sports industry!

What is something that you wish you had known as a first-year student? I wish I knew that it is okay for freshman year to be an adjustment period; as long as you focus, do your best, and make the most of the opportunities you have at your fingertips, everything will turn out fine.

If someone was to describe you in five words, what words do you think they would choose? Passionate, creative, assertive, determined, outgoing

Fun Fact: I own 47 baseball hats, 65 hats total, and I take inventory annually to see how many hats I have managed to collect over the course of the year.

Major: Advertising

Minor: Digital Media Trends & Analytics & Smeal Business Fundamentals Certificate

What are you involved in? Bellisario Fellow, Assistant Director of Penn State AAF Chapter, Vice President of Ad/PR club, Penn State Navigators Christian Ministry

What’s the dream career? I don’t have a specific job in mind, but I would love a career in advertising sales that I am passionate about while also giving me time to be with my wife and family.

What is something that you wish you had known as a first-year student? I was very focused on work defining my identity and I quickly became a workaholic. I wish I knew how important taking rest and time for yourself is, eliminating hurry from my life has been so beneficial!

If someone were to describe you in 5 words, what words do you think they would choose? (Feel free to ask someone close to you): Christian, runner, artistic, energetic, kind

Fun Fact: I did gymnastics for two weeks in elementary school but quit because I couldn’t touch my toes and we didn’t jump into the foam pit enough. (I still can’t touch my toes.)
